description: These plantain and smoky tofu enchiladas are rolled up and baked in spicy sauce and then served with a scoop of smoky refried black beans.
name: Black Bean Smothered Plantain & Tofu Enchiladas
recipeIngredient: 1 14 ounce can black beans, drained and rinsed
3 very ripe plantains, (cut into 1/2 inch thick pieces)
1 14 ounce package extra firm tofu, drained and patted dry

recipeInstructions.text: Coat the bottom of a medium pot with oil and place it over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the onion and sauté until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and sauté until very fragrant, about 1 minute more.

Add the beans and about 1 cup of water. Stir and bring the liquid to a simmer. Cook, uncovered, until the beans are very soft and falling apart, about 40 minutes, stirring occasionally and adding more water to the pot as needed, 1/2 cup at a time.
